titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the John B. Cornell papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Alina Borja

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-16T11:46-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Questionnaires, field notes, and statistics, relating to demographic characteristics of Japanese emigrants to the Noroeste region of Brazil. Includes studies summarizing findings, and a case study of Japanese in Getulina, São Paulo State.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p:
One study in Box 23 may not be quoted without permission of J. B. Cornell.
The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John B. Cornell papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1986.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Questionnaires, field notes, and statistics, relating to demographic characteristics of Japanese emigrants to the Noroeste region of Brazil. Includes studies summarizing findings, and a case study of Japanese in Getulina, São Paulo State.

did.unittitle: Family Background, Part 2, Pais do Informante,
The Japanese and Their Descendants in Brazil: An Annotated Bibliography,
Nissei Universitarios interviews and field notes,
Pamphlets for Cooperativo Agricola de Cotia,
Ethnic, Class, and Family Relations in Japanese Colonies in the Noroeste and Alta Paulista Frontier, Brazil,

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: May not be quoted without permission.
For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

did.unittitle: Nissei Studies papers by John B. Cornell,
Biographical and interpretive data cards by location,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Box 24 Contains data cards for the following locations and subjects (in order):
São Paolo (reviewed) São Paolo (duplicates) Lins (Nisei) Lins (Japanese) São Paolo (Japanese-Brazilian Associations) Junqueirópolis Mirandópolis (Japanese-Brazilians)

did.unittitle: Data cards on personal views and information,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains cards for the following subjects and locations (under these labels):
(500) Marriage and Family Duplicates for JBC Getulina: Potuguese Field Notes

did.unittitle: Information cards and duplicates in Japanese by location,

scopecontent.head: Locations for cards and duplicates
scopecontent.p: Mato Grosso Suzano, Seicho-no-le, Mirandópolis, Guatapará, Juquiá, Getulina, Santo Antonia da Platina
Seicho-no-le is not a place, but a religion. Still, it was included as a subject amongst the others.

did.unittitle: Information cards in Japanese by location,

scopecontent.head: Locations
scopecontent.p: Santo Antonio da Platina, City Getulina, City Getulina, Aliança Juquiá Matto Grosso Suzano, City

did.unittitle: Duplicate information cards in Japanese by location,

scopecontent.head: Locations
scopecontent.p: Junqueirópolis (Japanese) Junqueirópolis (Portuguese) Getulina (Portuguese) Guatapará (Portuguese) Suzano-Tijuco Preto Suzano (Japanese) Juquiá (Portuguese)

did.unittitle: Information cards in Japanese by location,

scopecontent.head: Locations and subjects
scopecontent.p: Junqueirópolis, Yamato Junqueirópolis, City Junqueirópolis, Boa Vista Guatapará Mirandópolis, Aliança 1 Mirandópolis, Aliança 3 Mirandópolis, copy Juquiá (duplicates) Nisei Associations (São Paolo)

scopecontent.head: Numbering
scopecontent.p: The cards numbered 0-499 and those numbered 600 and on are in this box. The 500 series is in Box 25 of the collection.
